boat.name: Ceres
boat.full_description:
Ceres was built by Everson & Sons of Woodbridge along lines lifted from a retired fishing smack, then refined from amidships aft to produce a handsome, counter-sterned yacht with a Maurice Griffiths designed sail plan.

She is a sturdy vessel, perfectly balanced and a delight to sail, with excellent sail options for a vessel of this type.

She was refurbished by John Wragg between 2001 and 2007.

After an on-water survey by Adrian Overbury, Rod Daniel bought her in December 2019 and renamed her Ceres. The Woodbridge Boatyard (formerly Everson's) is responsible for her 60th Birthday refurbishment.
boat.short_description: Ceres is a one-off gaff rigged yawl with a sail plan designed by Maurice Griffiths.

for_sales.sales_text:
Ceres ( formerly Rosanna’ and Glee) is 30ft LOD, 42ft LOA. Ill health placed up for sale in 2019. She draws attention wherever she goes, a yacht built for cruiser passage making. John Wragg sailed her solo most of the time and she is reported to be compact, comfortable and very able.

Valued at £57,000 for insurance purposes offshore  2007-19 this will be reviewed after completion of survey 2019-20. As priority early 2020 She requires deep cleaning, antifouling, topsides re-varnishing, deck and cockpit drain repairs, new s/s cooker bay lining. Taylors stove and cabin heater for refurbishment 2020. 

Extensively re- furbished from 2001- 2007. £25,000 all materials, excluding professional fitting & rebuild labour.
Browse the images as a gallery by clicking to enlarge.

30’ LOD, 42’ LOA, 26’ LOW, Beam 8"6', Draft 3"10', Air Draft 35", Engine Diesel Y3M20 20HP, Engine hours 377.

The possibility of re powering her to improve on the performance of offset wing prop and engine position will be evaluated in 2020.
Long keel, hull material wood, colour white. Displacement 6 tons, dry weight 5 tons.
Registration: SSR 156705 British Registered Ship 302311.
Fuel tank 120 ltr. Water tank 300 ltr.

Classic Boat May 12, 2014 (CB311) By Steffan Meyric-Hughes: Smack yacht `Rosanna’ restored

`Rosanna’, a one-off gaff rigged yawl built in 1960 by Everson & Sons of Woodbridge, was being lifted out for her annual maintenance as we went to press. `Rosanna’ was built along the lifted lines of a retired fishing smack, then refined through from amidships aft to produce a handsome, counter-sterned yacht‚ her shipwright/joiner owner John Wragg told CB. Maurice Griffiths designed her sail plan, a friend of the commissioning skipper. 'She"s a sturdy vessel, perfectly balanced and a delight to sail, with excellent sail options for a vessel of this type', said John, who refurbished her between 2001 and 2007. She is currently on the hard for the annual pre season jobs, John is doing some serious British cruising this year.

A pre sale survey on water performed by Adrian Overbury December 2019 'an immensely strong vessel' quote by the first survey by traditional surveyor Adrian Overbury 1999).  Aug 2015; Antifouled, mast unstepped & full 6 coat re-varnish to both new mizzen & main mast, Houdini hatch lazzerette coachroof & blocks.Topsides sanded undercoated & repainted with Toplac gloss.
 

Brief refurbishment details

The hull was stripped back of everything bar the keelson leaving the sheer planks to be replaced, the rest of the Honduras mahogany planking is in excellent condition as is the oak keelson. New oak stem from the apron/forefoot, oak sternpost very good condition, newly-rebated & through braced in 10mm s/s plates, & s/s rudder iron. New oak rudder, band epoxied & triple coated.

New sheer planks port/stbd fitted. New silicon bronze hood ends fore and aft. New steamed oak timbers throughout totally refastened, copper nailed & roved through Honduras mahogany carvel planking. All seams pin routered to clean wood. Later caulked with cotton, (keelson, stem & stern with oakum). Payed with a Sikaflex. The hull is described as very fair & totally watertight. A full system of International paints are applied above/below waterline, International antifoul based.

Quarter sawn 30mm x 8mm Iroko decking planks, epoxy glued to 4 x epoxy coated 18mm marine ply sub deck. Has minor shakes which lead to loosening around forehatch and Port aft deck by the time of December 2019 survey.  A raising bowsprit makes for easier close quarter maneuvering, more importantly reducing mooring fees by 9 ft. Offset 15" 3 blade phosphor bronze prop + spare.

Yanmar 3YM20 New & fitted in 2009. Powerful 3 cylinder diesel delivers smooth economical 2 ltr per hr @ 2700 rpm giving a range of 450 nm. twin tanks hold 120ltr plus 25ltr spare cradled in cockpit locker, top speed 7kts cruising 5 kts. Very well cared for.

Cozy small double berth (luxurious single!) in forward cabin, starboard shelving doubles as steps out of Houdini hatch to deck. Storage beneath and to port side, net keep. Sitting headroom only. 2 single berths in the saloon (one has a trotter box). Single sink & drainer. Pumped hot/cold water. 90L Coolmatic fridge freezer. Taylors gimbled 030L pressured paraffin cooker, needs refurbishing. Taylors 079D cabin heater (needs service) pumped from main diesel tank. Compact head and wet locker to port. Sitting Nav station to std.

Standing headroom only 5" 7' forward to 5" 2' at coachroof/bulkhead, traditional lines dictated this - a rare thing of beauty & performance. Obviously, there is sitting headroom in the saloon which allows for a big hat and raising a glass.

The mast is keel stepped (simple easy stepping/un-stepping), main mast, boom, main gaff, (mizzen new 2013), yard, bowsprit all Sitka spruce. Crosstrees & bumpkin in oak. Original bronze portholes. Silicone bronze rigging screws. All hardware, fittings, and rigging are new in 2007.
Bronze Wykham Martin jib furling system. All fittings are bespoke, over-engineered & made in 316 s/s bead blasted to give a galvanized look.
All standing rigging is 8mm 7x7 316 s/s traditionally hand spliced and served.

Quick Windlass 1000W Rider (New 2010) serving 30lb CQR 150ft 3/8th galvanized chain run through bespoke 316 s/s Bowroller into chain locker accessed in the forward cabin.  Deck foot controls & companionway controls.

RCD consumer unit. Shore power isolator internals replaced. 30mtr 240v shore power cable. 6 x 240v cabin plug points. 12v DC~230v AC 1800w Pro Power Q Inverter. 1 x 200 Ahr Sonnenschien domestic gel battery & 1 x 80 Ahr Optima starter gel battery. 240v CTEC Marine battery charging system. 12v/60amp charge through engine alternator. Battery monitor. Calorifier. Galvanic isolator. Navigation lights. Deck floodlights. 12v search light.
Simrad RD68 DSC VHF. Icom handheld VHF. Simrad IS12 depth/speed/log combi instrument. Garmin 152 GPS. Nasa Navtex pro. Raymarine ST40 wind instrument. Raymarine ST4000+ tiller autopilot. Compass.
Fusion Marine Entertainment system MS-IP700 i-pod stereo & radio. MS-HDTV with DVD player. 200w speakers. Omni-directional digital tv/radio antenna.

Varnished ash blocks with bead blasted 316 s/s frames new 2007.
All 4 strand Hempex running rigging
Braid on Braid sheets (hemp colour), 2 original jib winches & stay"sl winches.

All traditional sails hand finished using Clipper Canvas & gunmetal hardware by Stephen Hall of North Sea Sails, Tollesbury.
Jib on Wykeham-Martin furling gear, staysail with single reef point, gaff main with 3 reef points running through boom bee blocks, mizzen standing lug.
Folding kedge anchor & chain. Bespoke tabernacle set between bitts in 316 s/s for bowsprit raiser. Boom rest in 316s/s 50mm tube and oak. Fixed cradle spare 25 ltr diesel jerry in cockpit locker. Full-length jackstays & clip-ons. All running rigging in Hempex, mooring lines hand splice finished. Fenders.

6 x quality 18mm hand spliced mooring lines.
6 x new 600mm X 210mm fenders.

Bulkhead fastened marine first aid kit in heads.
2 x 2 ltr fire extinguishers (fore & aft) galley fire blanket
4 man canister Seago offshore liferaft in cradle (2010: needs service)
XM 45M Oscar rescue sling
Martec Epirb 0/0/D needs re-certification
Flares cannister O/O/D need replacement
2 lifejackets
Seago tender TSR 270 Airdeck/keel (2010: needs repair)
Suzuki 2.5 hp outboard (2010)
Secure framed 5-gallon spare diesel tank newly sprayed in black anti-corrosion paint.
New unused blocks, assortment carry box of s/s shackles, manuals, etc.

Inventory as listed by JW May 2019.
for_sales.summary: "Rosanna" is a custom built traditional gaff rigged yawl, built in 1960 and placed for sale due to ill health.
